title: Visualize Qsim Output
text: details install KWB-R packages checkout installation tutorial.
code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'qsimVis' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/qsimVis")

title: Adds colour scaled riverdata to a map — add_coloredRivers
text: rivers list rivers loaded load_rivers() output_table Table aggregated data created one functions critical_events(), adverse_deviation_from_reference() critical_events() sixBreaks Breaks defining lower limits categories. varName column name agregated data output_table dataType Used Legend. "time" used, assumed first water quality category 0 value 0, counting "events" first category 0 . LegendTitle String title legend LegendLocation Either "top" "right" (outside plot margin)

title: Relative adverse deviation from a reference — adverse_deviation_from_reference
Relative adverse deviation from a reference — adverse_deviation_from_reference
text: dataFrame Data frame time first column parameter values per site. reference data frame provided must include reference_vector column. reference Column name reference dataFrame seperate data frame contains column names dataFrame worst numerical value worst case

title: Relative adverse deviation from a reference — adverse_deviation_from_reference
text: Numeric value 0 1

title: Relative adverse deviation from a reference — adverse_deviation_from_reference
text: First similarity data vector reference vector calculated. complete pairs (NA values) used. data pair quotient data reference calcutaled. data > reference value set 1. quotients  cumulated (-> absolute similarity). can maximum number data pairs. deviding number data pairs, relative similarity obtained. One minus relative similarity negative deviation.

title: Count Events of deficits — critical_events
text: Counts Number intervals minimum time row defined threshold value. Events separated specified period time threshold. Furthermore, exceedance value can also separation criterion.

title: Count Events of deficits — critical_events
code: critical_events(   dataFrame,   separating_hours,   deficiency_hours,   threshold,   recovery_value = NULL,   return_event_positions = FALSE )

title: Count Events of deficits — critical_events
text: dataFrame Data frame time first column parameter values per site. separating_hours Minimal time period two values threshold count separate events. deficiency_hours Minimal time period values threshold. threshold Numeric unit data vector recovery_value NULL (default) two events separated numerical revocvery value exceeded two deficits. return_event_positions Instead number events, events starting end positions returned, corresponding data vector

title: Count Events of deficits — critical_events
text: Either number events data frame event start end position

title: Count Events of deficits — critical_events
text: deficiency_hours seperating_hours lead decimal number data points, numerical rounded next integer. example: minimum deficiency time 20 minutes 15 minute resolution mean least 2.3 data points must threshold values rounded 2 data points, deficiency time 25 minutes result 3 data points needed threshold.

Adds quality categories to the river table — extend_riverTable
text: river_table Table one rivers loaded load_rivers() output_table Table aggregated data created one functions critical_events(), adverse_deviation_from_reference() critical_events() varName column name agregated data output_table sixBreaks Breaks defining lower limits categories.

title: Adds quality categories to the river table — extend_riverTable
text: input river_table extended three columns: 1) "value" containing exact value, 2) "quality" containing 6 different quality categories based defined breaks, 3) "color" assigning th color plotting

title: Adds quality categories to the river table — extend_riverTable
text: qsim_misa_table provide information every location within river, since local resolution qsim output differs river course data. Values two known river sites interpolated. color scale changed. Since misa assessment parameters low values refer good water quality, colors range green low values red high values.

title: Filters the parameter data frame by time and sites — filter_parameter_data

title: Filters the parameter data frame by time and sites — filter_parameter_data

text: xlim Minimum maximum longitude map ylim Minimum maximum lattitude map width Numeric value defining width plot (inch)

title: Calculates x- and y-scale based on longitude and lattitude data — getDimensions
text: Named vector two, containing width (x-axis dimension) height (y-axis dimension).

title: Calculates x- and y-scale based on longitude and lattitude data — getDimensions
text: ratio width height directly based ratio lonigtude lattitude. order get correct scale plot margins need set 0 (see example).

title: Calculates x- and y-scale based on longitude and lattitude data — getDimensions
code: xlim <- c(13.18, 13.472) ylim <- c(52.46, 52.57) plotDim <- getDimensions(xlim = xlim, ylim = ylim, width = 10) plotDim #>     width    height  #> 10.000000  6.182557   dev.new(noRStudioGD = TRUE, width = plotDim[1], height = plotDim[2]) par(mar = c(0, 0, 0, 0)) # no margins outside of the plot plot(x = xlim, y = ylim, type = "l") text(x = mean(xlim), y = ylim[2],      labels = "Correctly Scaled Line",      pos = 1, cex = 3)

title: Reads river data — load_rivers
text: Reads csv files starting "river" folder combines list. csv defines river stretch region interest must least contain 5 columns: x: longitude y: lattitude distance_to_neighbour: distance previous point river km km: distance river estuary qsim_id: qsim ID d given function QSIM_prepare() point matches qsim output site
